description:
When using auto_assigned floating ips, they are counted in quota_usages table, but they never get removed. Running synchronisation (for example by resetting the `until_refresh` field) brings the floating_ips value to the correct level (query counts only manually assigned ips).

This is a regression from the time before reservations were happening.
title: auto_assigned floating ips are counted when used, but never removed

comments.content:
When using auto_assigned floating ips, they are counted in quota_usages table, but they never get removed. Running synchronisation (for example by resetting the `until_refresh` field) brings the floating_ips value to the correct level (query counts only manually assigned ips).

This is a regression from the time before reservations were happening.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~stanislaw-pitucha

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master

commit 5d18503be6981ab7e6bbf7743f2ee7505e0c1128
Author: Stanislaw Pitucha <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Sep 19 17:20:48 2012 +0100

    Don't include auto_assigned ips in usage
    
    Fix a regression - auto_assigned floating ips should not be included in
    the quota_usages table.
    
    Fixes bug 1052997
    
    Change-Id: Ifa98a5d44cf2a8a8d4c73b4f56b9615dd74b8383
